paragraphs.text:
ECMiner™ is a data analytics software developed by ECMiner Co., Ltd. Most of the features of ECMiner™ are pull-down menus easily accessible to non-technical users. Academics with expertise in analytical algorithms collaborated in the early days of the development ECMiner™. Subsequent versions are developed for providing a variety of data management, transforming, and model evaluation for real-world problems.
The key advantage of ECMiner™ is the following:
It supports various types of database formats, ECL (a proprietary data structure), TEXT, EXCEL, etc. Large volumes of data are manageable.
Pull and drag option for modeling is very convenient to users from loading data to analytics. Easily modified model deleting to adding nodes in analytical schema.
Configuration of full model is easily modified.
Prediction, classification, clustering, and Association Rules (AR), a powerful preprocessing node, a data browser, and charting for data visualization.

NOTE The performance of the system may vary depending on the number of users and the size of the database; the database size generally increases by about 500 Mbytes per year, assuming 1 Gbyte for each
year (500 Mbytes x 2) of data entry is typical.

Download the setup file and run it to install the software. For a trial version, you can download the trial version from the ECMiner Co., Ltd. website at www.ecminer.com.
[image:rId9]
Select Setup Language “English”.
[image:rId10]
Select [I accept the agreement(A)] and then click [Next(N)].
[image:rId11]
[image:rId12]
Choose whether to Create a desktop shortcut or Create a Quick Launch shortcut. ‘Create a desktop shortcut’ is recommended.
[image:rId13]
[image:rId14]
Installation is processing.
[image:rId15]
It checks the necessary .NET framework version for ECMiner operation. If it is already installed, this display does not come up.
[image:rId16] The installation is complete. Clicking [image:rId17] icon, the program starts.
[image:rId18]

In "Windows Settings (Control Panel)” _ "Apps > Installed apps", select ECMiner™ and click the 'Uninstall' button
[image:rId19]
ECMiner™ offers a user-friendly interface. Users can create various analytical models depending on the purpose.

ECMiner™ provides the following main window to enable easy and efficient data mining.
[image:rId20]

The menu is located at the top of the screen. It provides menus such as Project(P), Edit(E), View(V), Stream(S), Extension(A), Tool(T), Window(W), Help(H), and others.
Tool's Option allows to set up the user-specific option.

Data loading, data preprocessing, modeling and evaluation. Select and drag each node in order in the working space, and connect to each in turn.
[image:rId61]
The node window is classified into a total of seven categories.

S tart with Input Node, ‘Column filter’ and ‘Type change’ to define indep. & dep. Variables, and select either ‘Continuous’ or ‘Discrete’. Connect to modeling node.
[image:rId62]
The project window shows the flow map of the data analysis.

To activate a project, press the tab on the top.
[image:rId63] [image:rId64]
Various types of icons for different tasks.

Right-clicking in the project window displays all the menu nodes.
[image:rId78]
The newly added feature in this latest version, 'Insert Memo', is added for users to make notes when configuring nodes and projects
It shows the properties of the project or the selected node.

In the project properties window, you may add a memo of the project's objective and description. The Project Creator shows the username of the person logged into Windows and cannot be changed. [image:rId79]
Node property for data tells the variable names and data type. Data types can be changed.
Define the dependent and independent variables in ‘Type Change’.

In ECMiner™, resources refer to all files including data, results, models, and project files.
[image:rId81]
Local menu displays a list of files in the resource list.
Model menu shows the list of model files. You may utilize it for future runs.
Output menu displays the list of output for each project.
From the resource lists, you can filter the files using the toolbar buttons at the top.
After running modeling, the output models are listed. You may take out a model in the list which is not necessary.

After running modeling, the output results are listed in the project with sub-tree. Select the results you want to view. It shows the results for comparison. Additionally, it offers the ability to save results or view previously saved results.

A task folder in ECMiner™ is a frequently used one, which can be renamed (aliased) with another name. Users need to add the task folder themselves, and once added, the work folders will appear in the Local menu within the resource window. [image:rId85] You may Add/Delete/Modify the folder using the toolbar
Set the path where you want to add as a "Task Folder" pressing the [image:rId86] button, and give a folder name.
emphasized: Set the path where you want to add as a "Task Folder" pressing the [image:rId86] button, and give a folder name.

paragraphs.text: To change the contents (folder path, folder name), click the [image:rId88] button in the toolbar.
To delete a task folder, click the [image:rId89] button in the toolbar. A message box will pop up asking, "Are you sure you want to delete?" Pressing the ‘Yes’ button will delete the folder.
To reload the file list of the task folder, click the [image:rId90] button in the toolbar.
Right-clicking on the task folder in the Resource menu.
Give the name of folder, it will add the task folder.

By creating a work folder and gathering all files generated during analysis, such as data files, project files, and model files, you can manage everything in one place. This makes it easy to understand the content of the project without searching through multiple folders.
Creating work folders with the same name allows users to share data files without additional effort, accommodating differences in user environments.

The file lists of the selected folder.
[image:rId92]

If the data file you want to use is in the task folder, you can easily create an Input Node by drag & drop the file.
[image:rId101]
After running the model stream, temporary models are listed in the resource window. [image:rId102]

Files in the resource window are the result of executing the stream. The name executing result is identical with model node name.
[image:rId102]
To remove an ou t put file in the list, press [image:rId103]

[image:rId104]
To save a temporary model for another use, press [image:rId105] Give the model name and specify the path, "given_model name.gms " is saved in the task folder.
[image:rId106]
Another method to store a temporary is to ‘drag & drop’ into the task folder (subfolder).
[image:rId107]
[image:rId108] In the dialog box that appears, enter the name and a brief description for the model upon globalization. After specifying the save path, press the OK button. This will create a global model file named "global model name.gms " in the task folder (or subfolder) where you dropped it, indicating the save path.

The results created after executing the stream will appear in the list when the Output menu is selected.
[image:rId109]
To view a generated output again, double-click the output from the Result list. Alternatively, after selecting one or more outputs, press the [image:rId110] button located on the toolbar.
The toolbar provides the following functions:
Display all selected outputs from the list.
Delete all selected outputs from the list
If two or more output windows are currently open, arrange them into a grid format.
Similar to the feature described above, when you open two or more selected closed outputs, the outputs will be arranged in a grid format.
Arranges the currently open output windows in a cascading format.
Similar to the feature described above, when you open two or more selected closed outputs, the outputs will be arranged in a cascading format.
Save the output to the desired path in the *. ept file format
Open the saved output file(*. ept). The results will be added to the list under the "Other” category

The Message window displays execution information and errors related nodes during stream execution.
[image:rId122]
The types of messages can be categorized into five categories, differentiated by color as follows:

When you edit a node’s properties, a brief description of the selected property will be shown in the Dynamic Help section.
The toolbar provides following functions:
Navigate to the help for the selected node
Note: Pressing the button again will return to the dynamic help
Open the help window and search for the desired topic
All control windows in ECMiner™ can be repositioned and resized to fit the user's preferences.
To reposition the windows, follow each step:
1. Left-click and hold the title of the control window with the mouse
2. While dragging, move the mouse pointer over the icon of the location where you want to place the control window.
These icons indicate the top, bottom, left, and right sides within the control window that the mouse moves during the dragging process
These icons indicate the top, bottom, left, and right sides of the entire program window.
3. A blue rectangle will indicate where the control window will be located. Once you confirm the position, release the mouse button to change the location of the control window.
To resize the control window, left-click and drag its border when the mouse pointer changes to the resize shape ([image:rId131], [image:rId132]).
To close the control window, press “X” button or select "View > Toolbar" from the main menu.
To open a closed (invisible) control window, select "View > Toolbar" from the main menu.

Pressing the [image:rId133] button will minimize the control window and can be found right side of the entire program window. If you hover the mouse pointer over the marked tab, it will pop up. [image:rId134]
A left-click is used for function menus, a right-click is for support menus, and a double left-click is for results display.
Drag & drop the nodes you need in your ‘Stream’ in the Project window.
Clicking on a node in the Project window will display its properties.
Right-clicking pops up a menu for connect or disconnect nodes, delete nodes.
Double-clicking on results icon displays information about the result in the Output window.
The shortcut key is shown in the table. F5 is for ‘execute’ and Ctrl & S is for ‘save’ and so on.

The Program Settings opens when you select [Tool (T)] – [Option (O)] from the menu.
[image:rId135]
The options are organized into menu tabs, and when a tab is selected, an editing window appears. The options that can be set include General Program Settings, Default Database Setting, and Editing Frequently Used Nodes, among others.
The dialog is divided into tabs for these menus, allowing for selective settings according to the relevant option.

When you select the Program Settings under Tool(T) - Option(O), the following options window will appear. In this options window, you can set the Data/Time Format by country, the recognition method for numerical data, designate File Extensions to Display on the Resource window, and the Program Look method.
[image:rId142]

Selecting Default Database Setting from Tool (T) - Option (O) opens the following options window. The databases supported by ECMiner™ are ODBC and OLE DB. By entering the driver and login information in the options window below, it can be set as the default database information for database operations in the Project window, making it convenient to use.
[image:rId143]

Selecting Edit Frequently Used Nodes (Favorites) from Tool (T) - Option (O) brings up the following options window. Use the function buttons to add or remove nodes from Most used nodes. Added or removed nodes can be checked in the Most used nodes tab of the Node window.
[image:rId144]
